description: Route a cross-cutting design request to the correct specialist skill
input: I want to add a new shield mechanic that blocks incoming damage and has a durability system. Where should I start?
expected_behavior: Identifies systems-designer as primary, game-balancer as supporting. Suggests checking economy-designer for durability repair costs and ux-designer for shield UI indicator. Provides context from existing GDD combat section.

input: The combat section says bosses drop 500 Starlight Crystals, but I can't find that currency defined anywhere. Can you check?
expected_behavior: Identifies the missing currency definition as a consistency violation (rule ME-01). Suggests adding the currency to the economy section with source, sink, and exchange rate. Flags the issue for economy-designer.
rubric: Routes to appropriate skill for resolution

description: Suggest daily work priorities based on project state
input: What should I work on today?
expected_behavior: Checks project board status, identifies incomplete GDD sections, considers dependencies, and suggests the highest-priority task with context. Explains why this task is the most impactful.
rubric: Considers sprint goals or project board state
Provides context for why this is the priority

description: Parse and index a GDD directory structure
input: I just reorganized my GDD folder. Can you rescan and tell me what sections are present and which are missing?
expected_behavior: Runs parse_gdd.py or manually scans the directory. Maps files to the 12-section taxonomy. Reports which sections are present, which are missing, and their completeness status.
rubric: Uses the GDD section taxonomy correctly
